SCHEDULE 19

Termination Of Agreement And Effect On Principal Warehouse LeasesIn Respect Of The Principal Warehouse

In this schedule the following words and expressions shall, unless the context otherwise requires, have the following meanings:

1954 Actthe Landlord and Tenant Act 1954;
Orderthe Regulatory Reform (Business Tenancies) (England and Wales) Order 2003;
Rentsthe rents (including further or additional rents) and all other sums reserved as rent by the Principal Warehouse Leases;
Transferthe assignment of the Principal Warehouse Leases by the Contractor to ABC in a form to be approved by ABC acting reasonably;
Transfer Consentthe formal consent of the Landlord to the assignment of the Principal Warehouse Leases;
Underleaseany underlease which may be granted by the Contractor to ABC on the same terms as the Principal Warehouse Leases mutatis mutandis subject to such variations as the Contractor or ABC or the terms of the Principal Warehouse Leases may reasonably require (save that the rent in the Underlease shall be no higher than the Rent);
Underletting Consentthe formal consent of the Landlord to an underlease of the Principal Warehouse in accordance with the Principal Warehouse Leases.
  1. EFFECT OF TERMINATION

In the event that this Agreement is terminated by either party for any reason ("Termination") the following provisions of this paragraph 1 shall apply.

The Contractor will make an application to the Landlord forTransfer Consent to:

assign thePrincipal WarehouseLeasestoABCand in that event,

the provisions of paragraph 2 shall apply; and

ABCshall and the Contractor shall execute and complete the Transfer within five Business Days of the Transfer Consent having been obtained; or

if Transfer Consent is refused or has not been granted with two months of Termination the Contractor shall make anapplication to the Landlord for consent to underlet the whole of the Principal Warehouse toABCfor the remainder of the term of the lease less two days, but otherwise on the same terms as the Lease and in that event:

the provisions of paragraph 3 shall then apply; and

ABCwill and the Contractor will execute and complete the Underlease within five Business Days of the Underletting Consent having been obtained.

TRANSFER CONSENT

The Contractor shall useitsall reasonableendeavours toobtain,the Transfer Consent subject toABCcomplying with its obligations in paragraph 2.2.

ABCshall promptly:

supply all references and information reasonably required by the Landlord in connection with the Transfer Consent;

respond to all correspondence and approve all draft documentation relating to the application for the Transfer Consent;

comply with the Landlord's reasonable requirements relating to the grant of Transfer Consent;

give such assistance as may be reasonably required to obtain the Transfer Consent.

The Contractor shall keepABCfully informed of all steps taken in connection with such obligations and. provide copies of all documents and correspondence sent and received in relation to obtaining such Transfer Consent and shall supply a copy of the Transfer Consent toABCwhen obtained.

UNDERLETTING CONSENT

The Contractor shalluseall reasonableendeavours toobtain the Underletting Consent subject toABCcomplying with its obligations and the provisions set out in paragraphs 2.2 and 2.3 shall apply mutatis mutandis as if references to Transfer Consent and Transfer were references to Underletting Consent and Underlease respectively.

Any Underlease granted pursuant to this Schedule shall be excluded from Sections 24 to 28 (inclusive) of the 1954 Act and shall contain:

an agreement between the Contractor (as landlord) andABC(as tenant) that Sections 24 to 28 of the 1954 Act are excluded in relation to the tenancy created by the Underleases; and

references to the notice that the Contractor has served onABCin the form (or substantially in the form) set out in Schedule 1 to the Order and the statutory declaration thatABC(or a person duly authorised byABC) has made in relation to that notice in the form (or substantially in the form) set out in paragraph 8 of Schedule 2 to the Order.

The Contractor andABCagree to exclude the provisions of Sections 24 to 28 (inclusive) of the Landlord and Tenant Act (1954 Act) in relation to the tenancy to be created by the Underlease.

ABCconfirms that before it became contractually bound to enter into the tenancy to be created by the Underlease:

the Contractor served onABCa noticein relation to the tenancy to be created by the Underlease as required by Section 38A(3)(a) of the 1954 Act; and

ABC, or a person duly authorised byABCmade a statutory declaration in accordance with the requirements of Section 38A(3)(b) of the 1954 Act.

ABCfurther confirms that where the declaration referred to in paragraph 3.4(b) of this Schedule was made by a person other thanABC, the declarant was duly authorised byABCto make that declaration onABC' behalf.

If the Landlord unlawfully or unreasonably refuses to grant both Transfer Consent and Underletting Consent or the Landlord has not providedeither the Transfer Consent or the Underletting Consent within six months of Termination (whichever shall be the earlier), if the Contractor andABC(each acting reasonably) consider that there is more than a 0% chance of success the Contractorshall at the joint expense of the Contractor andABCimmediately make application to the court for a declaration that such Transfer Consent has been unreasonably withheld provided always for the avoidance of doubt that the Contractor will not beobliged to make such an application ifABChas not complied with its obligations under clauses 2 and 3.

OCCUPATION

In the event of Termination then the Contractor will immediately grantABClicence (whether in writing or not) to occupy the Principal Warehouse for such reasonable period asABCproperly requires andABCshall within ten business days ofwrittendemand and on the Contractor providing such evidence as shall reasonably be required byABCthat such payments have been made pay the rents and other outgoings paid by or on behalf of the Contractor under the terms of the Lease.

ENFORCEMENT OF PRINCIPAL WAREHOUSE LEASES

The Contractor shall enforce the covenants on the part of the Landlord contained in the Lease.
